item.title: SUCCESS Corporation announces TGS 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
Cotton Rock 'n' Roll 2 returns with new title.

SUCCESS Corporation has opened its Tokyo Game Show 2025 website and announced its lineup for the event, which will rn from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Tokyo, Japan.

Get the details below.

■ Lineup

  • Cotton Rock With You (PS5, Switch 2, PC, Arcade) – Playable
    • Note: This title was previously referred to as Cotton Fantasy 2 / Cotton Rock ‘n’ Roll 2.
  • Unannounced Shoot ‘Em Up Game – To be revealed on September 25.

■ Novelty

  • Cotton Rock With You
    • Original Tin Badge – Play the demo to get the badge.
    • Original Clear File – Play the demo to get the clear file.
  • Unannounced Shoot ‘Em Up Game
    • Original Tin Badge – Play the demo to get the badge.
    • Original Clear File – Play the demo to get the clear file.
  • Cotton Rock ‘n’ Roll x Cotton Reboot Steam Bundle
    • Original Sticker – Original stickers celebrating the release of the Cotton Rock ‘n’ Roll x Cotton Reboot Steam Bundle will be given out at the SUCCESS Corporation and BEEP booths.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/success-corporation-announces-tgs-2025-lineup

item.title: STUDIO 909 and Kazuhide Oka announce adventure game Quiet Express: Cabin 909 for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

"Do you know anything about Cabin 909?"

STUDIO 909 and Kazuhide Oka have announced Quiet Express: Cabin 909, an adventure game about a cabin train that is nowhere to be found. It will be available for PC via Steam with English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support. A release date was not announced. It will be playable at Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

In Quiet Express: Cabin 909, you spend a week on the titular train, journeying from one side of the continent to the other as the landscape silently unfolds outside the windows. The other passengers’ lives, too, will unfold all around you. Some stay in their cabins to chat, some are drinking coffee in the dining car. They all travel the same road, but they all are on different journeys.

“Do you know anything about Cabin 909?”

You’re looking for Cabin 909, a cabin that shouldn’t exist on the Quiet Express. According to the passengers and even the conductor, there is no cabin with that number. Where is it, then? And what happened there? Throughout your journey, you’ll discover the truth little by little.

Staff

  • Scenario and Development: Kazuhide Oka
  • Art and Environment Models: Kohei Miyahara
  • Concept Key Visual and Character Models: ASAMIYA KOBO
  • Soundtrack: ruichiro
  • Logo Art: JEFF99
  • English Translation: Marco Godano
  • Simplified / Traditional Chinese Translation: flankoi
  • Korean Translation: TansanCoffee (TSCF)
  • Public Relations: mri, Shoya Kido

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/studio-909-and-kazuhide-oka-announce-adventure-game-quiet-express-cabin-909-for-pc

item.title: TGS 2025 official live stream program schedule announced
item.content:encoded:
Capcom, Nioh 3, Xbox, LEVEL-5, and more.

The Computer Entertainment Supplier’s Association has announced the official streaming program schedule for Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan. You will be able to watch it on YouTube.

Get the details below.

■ Record-Breaking 1,138 Exhibitors and 4,159 Booths (as of September 9)

As of September 9, the total number of exhibitors is 1,138 (including 28 online exhibitors), with 523 domestic and 615 overseas exhibitors. The number of physical booths at the venue has reached 4,159, greatly surpassing the previous record in 2024, making this the largest Tokyo Game Show ever. In addition, the number of game titles to be exhibited as of September 4 has reached 1206titles.

Exhibits will cover a wide range of genres and platforms̶including home consoles, smartphones, and PCs̶with highlights such as highly anticipated new releases, esports titles, AR/VR games, and blockchain games. Hardware, furniture, and business solutions enhancing the gaming environment will also be showcased, making TGS2025 a place to obtain and experience a wide variety of B2B and B2C information.

■ Event Stage and Official Program Timetables Announced

The timetables for event stages and official programs taking place during the show have been released today. Over the four days of Tokyo Game Show 2025, a total of 14 stage programs (including seven organized by exhibitors) and 21 official programs are planned. Programs organized by the host will also be streamed as official programs.

September 24

  • 23:00 to 23:50 – Tokyo Game Show 2025 Capcom Online Special Program – Get all the latest Capcom news in our pre-recorded stream as part of Tokyo Game Show 2025!

September 25

  • 09:30 to 10:00 – Opening Ceremony – The opening ceremony of Tokyo Game Show 2025, one of Japan’s largest gaming festivals, will be streamed online this year!
  • 11:00 to 12:00 – Keynote Speech – Game Distribution Innovation: The Impact of PlayStation Store – Sony Interactive Entertainment and the PlayStation brand have helped create an era where people can enjoy the fun of gaming and connecting with other players across the world. It has been nearly 20 years since the introduction of downloadable games and add-on content, alongside the distribution of games through disc media. PlayStation Store has contributed to the gaming industry by strategically leveraging the network as a new means of content delivery, beyond physical media. In this session, we’ll look back on its two-decade journey and explore its role and significance.
  • 13:00 to 14:00 – AKIBA LOST Special Stage – A special talk stage for AKIBA LOST, the upcoming live-action adventure game from IzanagiGames, Nippon TV, and AX-ON. Director and producer Shunsuke Umeda of IzanagiGames will share the latest information alongside special guests.
  • 14:30 to 14:45 – Annapurna Interactive New Titles Stage – Indie game publisher Annapurna Interactive, known for titles such as STRAY and Outer Wilds, will make its debut appearance at Tokyo Game Show. Will be held on the official Tokyo Game Show stage, delivering the latest updates a new title slated for release in 2026. Featuring a representative from Annapurna Interactive and a game developer from Marumittu Games.
  • 19:00 to 19:50 – Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Broadcast – The Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Game Showcase will kick off at 6:00 PM Beijing time on September 25, where we will share the latest developments from our studio and an exciting lineup of games from creators in Japan and across Asia.
  • 20:00 to 20:50 – Nioh 3 Official Program – An introduction to the dark sengoku action RPG Nioh 3, which is due out in 2026, including the latest information and live gameplay. Presenters include MC Hatsune Matsushima, general producer Fumihiko Yasuda, and producer Kohei Shibata.
  • 21:00 to 21:50 – LEVEL-5 Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program – We will be streaming a LEVEL-5 Live Broadcast as part of the Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program, beginning at 9:00 p.m. JST on September 25. The program will showcase gameplay from our titles along with the latest news. Stay tuned for more details!
  • 22:00 – Eiko Kano’s Critikano Hit Tokyo Game Show 2025 Special – Join the members of Critikano Hit as they play through the upcoming Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake in this special program! Be among the first to view new gameplay of the opening scenes of Dragon Quest I and watch Eiko Kano face off against a fearsome foe! Yuji Horii, the creator of the Dragon Quest series, makes a guest appearance in this episode, so be sure to tune in! Featuring Eiko Kano (media personality), Kenta Sakai (Alco and Peace), Masayuki Kibe (television writer), and Yuji Horii (game designer).

September 26

  • 12:05 to 12:55 – Shinsen Series Official Broadcast – The latest information o nthe Shinsen brand from Qookka Games, including the latest information on Nobunaga’s Ambition: Shinsen and Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Shinsen.
  • 13:00 to 14:00 – Battlefield 6: Single-Player Live Showcase – The developers and English voice actors of Battlefield 6 introduce the upcoming first-person shooter, including a look at the single-player story mode. Featurin executive special producer Phillipe Ducharme and senior creative director Roman Campos-Oriola.
  • 14:30 to 16:30 – Red Bull Apex Takeover with Yuki Tsunoda – F1 driver Yuki Ysunoda teams up with Red Bull players to compete in a special Apex Legends match at Tokyo Game Show.
  • 22:00 to 23:50 – Sense of Wonder Night 2025

September 27

  • 00:00 to 00:50 – Full Metal Schoolgirl Live Gameplay Special – The latest information on Full Metal Schoolgirl with live gameplay. There will also be a giveaway. Featuring voice actors Hitomi Sekine Konomi Inagaki, and producer Nobuyuki Okajima.
  • 13:15 to 14:15 – Anniversary Title Producers’ Talk – A special talk session featuring producers from three major game franchises celebrating milestone anniversaries this year! Yusuke Tomizawa from the Tales of series, Junichi Taya from the eFootball series, and Hiroyuki Sakamoto from the Yakuza series will take the stage to reveal the stories behind these long-beloved titles. From the rich history of each series, to the evolving philosophies of game development shaped by changing times, and the unique insights and challenges that come with managing long-running franchises—this session is packed with deep, exclusive conversations you won’t hear anywhere else!
  • 14:45 to 16:30 – Red Bull 283 Academy – A special program to cultivate the youth that shape our future. This year’s game will be Street Fighter 6. Online preliminaries will beheld, and the top-ranked players will be invited to a training camp led by professional instructors.

September 28

  • 10:00 to 11:00 – Game Sampo – Popular YouTube channel Game Sanpo will be livestreaming from the Tokyo Game Show stage! Join comedian Yasuko as they explore the world of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater together!
  • 11:30 to 12:30 – 2K Games – Coming soon.
  • 13:00 to 14:45 – Japan Game Awards 2025
  • 15:15 to 15:45 – Ending Stage and Special Raffle – This is the final stage program to conclude Tokyo Game Show 2025. There will also be a raffle with prizes on the spot!


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/tgs-2025-official-live-stream-program-schedule-announced

item.title: KAMITSUBAKI ACADEMY NEWSPAPER CLUB adds Switch version, launches October 30
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Urban exploration school adventure game dated.

KAMITSUBAKI ACADEMY NEWSPAPER CLUB, an urban exploration school adventure game set in the world of KAMITSUBAKI CITY, will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on October 30 for 3,080 yen, KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO announced. The Switch version is newly announced. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

You wake up with amnesia in Kamitsubaki City, a city with a giant tower in its center.

There, you meet a girl named Kafu Morisaki, and begin participating at the Kamitsubaki Academy Newspaper Club at her invitation.

You will deepen your bonds with Kafu and the other club members through school life and your investigations of the city.

Introduction

KAMITSUBAKI ACADEMY NEWSPAPER CLUB is an urban investigation school adventure game where you look into Kamitsubaki City’s rumors and secrets with the members of the club.

The game is divided into two modes: “Story parts” where you hang out with the members at school, and “investigation parts” where you explore and investigate Kamitsubaki City.

(This game shares part of its setting and lore with the KAMITSUBAKI CITY series. However, the story here is standalone, you can enjoy this game without having experienced any of the other works.)

Story Parts

Segments where you read through the story via interactions with your fellow newspaper club members.

The story begins with you waking up in Kamitsubaki City with amnesia.

You then meet with the girls and go to school at Kamitsubaki Academy while searching for clues to recovering your memories.

You can advance to story parts by investigating in investigation parts and acquiring items.

Investigation Parts

Segments where you explore Kamitsubaki City with the newspaper club members and look into rumors and investigation requests.

You can progress with your investigations little by little by walking around the city and encountering events occuring in all sorts of locations.

At these events, you make “investigation conclusions” based on five parameters: “Movement,” “Wisdom,” “Insight,” “Mystery,” and “Luck.”

You can improve your parameters by gathering Items and Perks.

Fellow Newspaper Club Members

  • Kafu Morisaki
  • Rime Tanioki
  • Haru Asanushi
  • Sekai Yorukawa
  • Koko Rinne


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/kamitsubaki-academy-newspaper-club-adds-switch-version-launches-october-30

item.title: Kemco announces TGS 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
Depth Loop and new Adventure Bar game playable.

Kemco has opened its Tokyo Game Show 2025 website and announced its lineup for the event, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Here are the details:

■ Lineup

  • Depth Loop (PS5, Switch 2, PS4, Xbox One, PC) – Playable
    • Genre: Adventure
    • Release Date: Spring 2026
    • Description: Pushed to the brink of extinction by a pandemic, humanity’s last hope lies in a deep-sea facility. But when a werewolf infiltrates the crew, the brilliant scientists are thrust into a deadly game of suspicion. Can you unravel the mystery of Depth Loop and secure humanity’s future?
  • Ending the Happy Route (PS5, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC)
    • Genre: Adventure
    • Release Date: October 2
    • Description: Someone has sealed away the true routes, leaving only the worst possible ones behind. To restore the rightful world, the protagonist must join forces with you—the player—to unlock the original paths.
  • Ringamu-Koku no Bokensakaba (iOS, Android, Consoles)
    • Genre: RPG
    • Developer: RideonJapan
    • Release Date: Winter 2025
    • Description: A young boy opens a tavern to protect an orphanage. His encounter with a memoryless goddess changes the world—explore, cook, and manage in this relaxing tavern management RPG!


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/kemco-announces-tgs-2025-lineup

item.title: LEVEL-5 announces TGS 2025 lineup
item.content:encoded:
Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road and Professor Layton and The New World of Steam.

LEVEL-5 has opened its Tokyo Game Show 2025 website and announced its lineup of games for the event, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Get the details below.

■ Lineup

  • FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • Professor Layton and The New World of Steam (Switch 2, Switch)

The LEVEL-5 booth will feature multiple demo stations for Professor Layton and the New World of Steam and INAZUMA ELEVEN: Victory Road. In addition, at the Family Game Park, you can also try out FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time, bringing the total to three playable titles. Come enjoy our latest games together with your family and friends!

*All titles in both the LEVEL-5 General Exhibition Area and the Family Game Park will be playable on Nintendo Switch 2.

■ Trial Rewards

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time

Original Memo Pad

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road

Original Rubber Wristband

*One original rubber wristband (random design) will be given per demo play.

Professor Layton and The New World of Steam

Original Smartphone Ring Holder

*The original smartphone ring holder uses an adhesive attachment.

■ Booth Visitor Rewards

Shiny A4-size Original Metallic Clear File!

*Available while supplies last.

■ Booth Map

■ Live Broadcast

September 25

  • 21:00 – LEVEL-5 Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program – We will be streaming a LEVEL-5 Live Broadcast as part of the Tokyo Game Show 2025 Official Program, beginning at 9pm on September 25th (JST). The program will showcase gameplay from our titles along with the latest news. Stay tuned for more details!


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/level-5-announces-tgs-2025-lineup

item.title: Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Broadcast set for September 25
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Updates from Xbox and partners in Japan, Asia, and around the world.

Microsoft Gaming will host the Xbox Tokyo Game Show 2025 Broadcast on September 25 at 3:00 a.m. PT / 6:00 a.m. ET / 19:00 JST, the company announced. It will feature content from Microsoft Gaming’s creative teams, as well as “exciting updates” from partners in Japan, Asia, and around the world. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (English, Japanese) and Twitch (English).

The live stream will be available on select Xbox social channels in Japanese, English, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Arabic (MSA), French, German, Italian, Polish, Brazilian Portuguese, Castilian Spanish, Mexican Spanish, and Turkish, as well as in Japanese Sign Language (JSL), American Sign Language (ASL), and with audio descriptions in both Japanese and English. Following the broadcast, language support will be added for Canadian French, Filipino, Hindi, Indonesian, Malay, Māori, Russian, Thai, Ukranian, and Vietnamese.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/xbox-tokyo-game-show-2025-broadcast-set-for-september-25

item.title: Digimon Story: Time Stranger demo announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Coming "soon," but no specific date.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Media.Vision will release a downloadable demo for Digimon Story: Time Stranger ahead of the game’s release.

The news comes via a newly published interview with Gamersky, in which producer Ryosuke Hara confirms a demo is coming “soon.” 4Gamer.net‘s preview of the game today also confirms a demo is planned.

The new previews are based on four hours of hands-on with the game. Previews are available at 4Gamer.net (Japanese), Bahamut (Traditional Chinese), But Why Tho?, Checkpoint, Comics Gaming Magazine, Easy Allies, Famitsu, Game Chosun (Korean), Game Rant, GamerBraves, Gamer.ne.jp (Japanese), Gamersky (Simplified Chinese), GameSpot, Geek Culture, IGN, MMORPG, Noisy Pixel, The Outer Haven, PlayStation Blog, PushSquare, ScreenHub, TheSixthAxis, TechRaptor, and WellPlayed.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on October 3.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/digimon-story-time-stranger-demo-announced

item.title: Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter ‘Battle’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Choose between real-time and turn-based combat.

Publisher GungHo Online Entertainment and developer Falcom have released a new trailer for Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter showcasing the game’s battle system.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 19 worldwide. A demo is available now. Read more about the game here, here, here, here, here, here, and here.

Watch the trailer below.

Battle Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/trails-in-the-sky-1st-chapter-battle-trailer

item.title: Steel Knight’s ARMIS launches October 8
item.content:encoded:
Ensemble drama and roguelike shoot ’em up hybrid Steel Knight’s ARMIS will launch for PC via Steam on October 8, developer Izanami Game Lab announced. A demo is now available, allowing you to play through the game to Chapter 2.

Here is an overview of the demo, via Izanami Game Lab:

Players take on the role of pilots of the “ARMIS (Advanced Robotic Mechanized Interceptor System)” and lead the rebel forces against the Imperial and Earth Federation forces as they fight their way through a battlefield full of dramatic twists and turns. Not only will you face countless waves of enemies, but you’ll also face off against enemy pilots who pilot their own unique ARMIS.

And here is an overview of the game:

About

Steel Knight’s ARMIS is where ensemble drama meets roguelike shooting. Its gameplay bears many similarities to the survivors-like genre, bolstered by a rich story and a cast of unique characters. If you’re a fan of classic Japanese mecha anime like Gundam then this game is not to be missed! Board your ARMIS and face your destiny as you fight various battles against countless enemies.

Key Features

  • The Exhilaration of Annihilation – Overwhelm hordes of enemies through the sheer strength of your ARMIS! Keep upgrading your build and defeat them all
  • Dramatic Story – Expect high-impact drama to go alongside high-tension battles. The game features five full chapters each with a different protagonist and cast
  • Transition to Vertical Shooting – Seamlessly transition to a vertical shooting mode, delivering fresh and exhilarating gameplay – this is a survivor-like that’s built different!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/steel-knights-armis-launches-october-8
